definition: your work (book, musical composition etc) (honorific)/to erupt/to begin abruptly
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
a little bit of it does one good, but carried to excess it's harmful (idiom)
pinyin: xiao3 zuo4 yi2 qing2 , da4 zuo4 shang1 shen1

definition: variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]

sentences.english: Don't make such a fuss,will you?
sentences.chinese: 请你不要小题大作好吗？

sentences.english: The two thoughts have ever greatly contributed to the development of mathematics.
sentences.chinese: 这两种思想对数学发展都曾起过巨大作用。

sentences.english: My supervisor often likes to make mountains out of molehills.
sentences.chinese: 我的主管常常喜欢小题大作。

sentences.english: "Thank you for sending me a copy of your book; I'll waste no time reading it. " —Moses Hadas.
sentences.chinese: 感谢您送我的大作样书，我不会浪费时间拜读的。

sentences.english: World peace has been Ikeda Daisaku's value pursuit.
sentences.chinese: 世界和平是池田大作的价值追求。

sentences.english: I've read your article and I expected to see an older man.
sentences.chinese: 我拜读过您的大作，并且期望看见一个老一点的人。

sentences.english: It rained heavily while it was thundering. And it had a strong wind.
sentences.chinese: 但是昨天的天气糟糕极了，狂风大作，雷雨交加。

sentences.english: You re'sly have an ear for pop music.
sentences.chinese: 你确凿对大作音乐很有欣赏力。

sentences.english: It is adopted from the first classic of Mr. Wan Ray-an, a master of new style of martial arts novels.
sentences.chinese: 改编自新派武侠小说名家温瑞安先生的首部经典大作。

sentences.english: She made this big deal out of going on a business trip to San Francisco last week.
sentences.chinese: 上周去旧金山出差时，她有些小题大作。

sentences.english: As the thunder started the sleeping children began to stir.
sentences.chinese: 随着雷声大作，熟睡的孩子们开始乱作一团。

sentences.english: As presidential cover-ups go, it may be splitting hairs.
sentences.chinese: 如果说总统是在掩盖什么，那可能有点小题大作了。

sentences.english: The lighting flashed and thunder crashed .
We have read your article. We expect to meet an older man.
sentences.chinese: 我们拜读过你的大作，没想到你竟然这么年轻。

sentences.english: But even in science imagination plays a role in justification too.
sentences.chinese: 但是即使在科学中，想象在证明中也发挥巨大作用。

sentences.english: I have read your article. I expected to meet an older man.
sentences.chinese: 我拜读过您的大作，没想到您这么年轻。

definition: to put effort into (work, farming, writing etc)/a masterpiece
to spring up everywhere/from all around
wide expanse/large area/vast stretch/extending widely/blockbuster movie
to engulf/to sweep/to carry away everything
